clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the management of renal tubular acidosis hypocitraturic calcium oxalate nephrolithiasis and uric acid lithiasis with or without calcium stones

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Potassium citrate induces changes in the urine which renders urine less susceptible to the formation of crystals and stones from salts e g calcium oxalate calcium phosphate and uric acid Increased citrate levels in the urine will make complexation with calcium which decrease the calcium ion activity and decrease the chance for the formation of calcium phosphate crystals Citrate also inhibits the spontaneous nucleation of calcium oxalate and calcium phosphate
